meanings.definition: Organic matter recycled from sewage, used as fertilizer.
meanings.sent1: The biosolids were spread on the fields to help the crops grow.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use biosolids to enrich the soil and improve plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The biosolids decided to take a break from being fertilizer and try their hand at being compost instead.
meanings.sent4: The biosolids worked like magic, transforming the barren land into a lush garden.
meanings.sent5: The biosolids were like nature's own fertilizer, nourishing the earth and promoting life.

meanings.definition: The solid organic material produced by sewage treatment.
meanings.sent1: After the sewage treatment process, biosolids are left behind as a valuable resource.
meanings.sent2: The biosolids collected from the treatment plant were used in various eco-friendly projects.
meanings.sent3: The biosolids threw a party to celebrate their transformation from waste to useful material.
meanings.sent4: The biosolids were the unsung heroes of the sewage treatment process, quietly doing their job.
meanings.sent5: The biosolids gleamed under the sunlight, a reminder of the potential in recycling organic waste.
